instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.

threads.title: 820 3115 missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: 820 3115 missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>, and quarter fan spin. Cant find any shorts, I replaced <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>, no change.

threads.title: 820 3115 missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the ISL? Corrosion near BIOS possibly corroded probe points? <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is definitely not shorted to ground?

threads.title: 820 3115 missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I got it working now, this machine has an EFI swap done on it at some point in the past. The solder joints looked so/so, I pulled the chip and resoldered it. The machine boots now. Thanks John

threads.title: 820 3115 missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Quarter fan spin means <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is pulsing at least.
The fan requires <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL> to spin.
So your board tries to enter S0 even...

Look if all big coils pulse.
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulsing too?

I hope <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> are stable; you didn't mention them.

threads.title: 820 3115 missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: 2info, I got it solved, it was a poorly soldered SPI ROM, done by some one previously. Thank you

threads.title: 820 3115 missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Seems that my message appeared later...
